page.title: 10Cotton End Lower School
page.content: This school has been in existence for just over 100 years and at present there are 44 pupils on the school role, aged between those rising 5 and those who are 8 plus. Divided between 2 classes these children are taught by 2 full time teachers, one of whom is the headmistress and 2 part-time teachers who supervise group work, music etc. The present headmistress took up her post in September 1984, since when some major curriculum changes have taken place. In addition to new maths, reading and language development schemes, primary science has been introduced. Here the children learn through such activities as seed dissection and understanding and using batteries. Art, craft, handicrafts, drama, cookery and environmental studies are on the timetable, with computer clubs.
